content: vanilla socks mormor style 1 copyright tone cecilie nystrøm 2023 tcstrikk@hotmail com tonececilie on ravelry @tcknits on instagram these socks are designed as a homage to my mormor my maternal grandmother together with my mother she taught me to knit when i was 5 years old she has through my childhood made me countless sweaters however when she grew older this reversed and i started knitting for her one tradition lasted though every christmas she knitted a pair of socks for each of her grandchildren tucked some money in the toe and placed them under the tree we all loved out knitted socks my plan is to become that kind of grandmother i hope you will find comfort whilst knitting these socks sizes 1 2 3 circumference 18 20 22cm foot length adjustable yarn light fingering weight sample uses crazy zauberball from schoppel wolle 100gr/420m yardage 65gr/273m size 1 gauge in 2 by 2 rib 32 sts/45 row = 10 cm needles 2 5mm dpn s or circular needles for magic loop pattern notes the socks are knit top-down you can easily adjust the length of the leg to your own liking due to the ribbed pattern the circumference of the sock is quite small this allows for a snug and tight wear 2 copyright tone cecilie nystrøm 2023 tcstrikk@hotmail com tonececilie on ravelry @tcknits on instagram instructions leg co 64 72 80 sts distribute sts across needles place marker to indicate beginning of round join to work in the round be careful not to twist sts k2 p2 to leg measures 16 cm or desired length knit one more round but stop before last st this will be the first st of the heel flap heel flap row 1 rs sl1wyib k31 35 39 sts the next 32 36 measure the length of the 40 sts will be placed on hold for the instep the held sts heel to get the perfect fit will both start and end with a single purl st repeat row 1 & 2 the turn work amount of times that fit row 2 ws sl1wyif p1 16 18 20 times 32 36 40 you just remember to pick sts have been worked turn work up one st in every edge st for the gusset repeat row 1-2 a total of 16 17 18 times heel flaps do not necessarily have to be longer for a heel turn larger circumference of the row 1 rs sl1wyib k17 19 21 ssk k1 turn work foot row 2 ws sl1wyif p5 5 5 p2tog p1 turn work row 3 rs sl1wyib k to 1 st before gap ssk 1 st from each side of the gap k1 turn work row 4 ws sl1wyif p to 1 st before gap p2tog 1 st from each side of the gap p1 turn work repeat row 3 & 4 until all heel sts have been worked ending with a ws row note on the last repeat you finish row 3
